alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; McClain; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 9:44AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Seminole, northeastern Cleveland, northwestern Pontotoc, Pottawatomie and southeastern McClain Counties through 1015 AM CDT... At 943 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles northwest of Pink to 3 miles southeast of Macomb to 4 miles north of Stratford. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northeastern Norman, Shawnee, Seminole, Tecumseh, Pink, Konawa, Byng, Maud, Earlsboro, Bowlegs, Asher, Tribbey, Wanette, Francis, Byars, Johnson, St. Louis, Etowah, Brooksville and Macomb. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 174 and 193. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
